meanings.definition: The amount that a trunk can hold.
meanings.sent1: She packed so many clothes in her trunk that it was overflowing with trunkfuls.
meanings.sent2: The traveler brought trunkfuls of souvenirs back from their trip.
meanings.sent3: When the magician opened the trunk, trunkfuls of colorful scarves flew out.
meanings.sent4: The treasure hunter discovered trunkfuls of gold coins buried in the sand.
meanings.sent5: The farmer harvested trunkfuls of apples from the orchard.

meanings.definition: A large quantity of items stored in a trunk.
meanings.sent1: The attic was filled with trunkfuls of old family heirlooms.
meanings.sent2: She donated trunkfuls of clothes to the charity for those in need.
meanings.sent3: The kids pretended the trunkfuls of toys were pirate treasure.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter spilled out in trunkfuls as she opened the memory-filled trunk.
meanings.sent5: The garage sale attracted customers looking for trunkfuls of bargains.
